de.sub.goobi.forms

Class GranularityForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.forms.GranularityForm

  • public class GranularityForm
extends Object
    The class GranularityForm provides the screen logic for a JSF page to choose the granularity to split up the course of appearance of a newspaper into Kitodo processes.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Course course
      The field course holds the course of appearance previously created by the calendar form instance that from the information about the issues that appeared is taken to be shown.
      protected Granularity generateBatches 
      protected Granularity granularity
      The field granularity holds the granularity chosen by the user.
      protected Long numberOfPages
      The field numberOfPages holds the total number of pages of the digitization project guessed by the user.

      The function getIssueCount() returns the number of issues that physically appeared as to the underlying course of appearance data model as read-only property “issueCount”.

      The function getLockMessage() returns an empty string if either no limit for the minimal number of pages per process has been configured, or the limit has been reached, which will allow normal processing.

      The function getNumberOfPages returns the total number of pages of the digitization project guessed and entered by the user—or null indicating that the user didn’t enter anything yet—as read-write property “numberOfPages”.

      The function getNumberOfPages returns the total number of pages of the digitization project entered by the user or a guessed value as read-only property “numberOfPagesOptionallyGuessed”.

    • Field Detail

      • generateBatches

        protected Granularity generateBatches

      • granularity

        protected Granularity granularity
        The field granularity holds the granularity chosen by the user. It is null initially indicating that the user didn’t choose anything yet.

      • course

        protected Course course
        The field course holds the course of appearance previously created by the calendar form instance that from the information about the issues that appeared is taken to be shown. This field is a managed property which is automatically populated by JSF upon form creation by calling setCourse().

      • numberOfPages

        protected Long numberOfPages
        The field numberOfPages holds the total number of pages of the digitization project guessed by the user. It is null initially indicating that the user didn’t enter anything yet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GranularityForm

        public GranularityForm()

    • Method Detail

      • daysClick

        public void daysClick()
        The procedure daysClick() is called if the user clicks the button to select the granularity level “days”. It sets the granularity to BreakMode.DAYS and triggers the recalculation of the breaks in the course of appearance data model.

      • createProcessesClick

        public String createProcessesClick()
        The procedure createProcessesClick() is called if the user clicks the button to create processes for the course of appearance. If the underlying ProzesskopieForm is incomplete, the user will be redirected back to the page to fix the problems and nothing more happens. If everything is fine, the meta data field “PublicationRun”—if available—is populated with the course of appearance in text form. Then, a long running task to create processes is prepared and the user will be redirected to the task manager page where it can observe the task progressing.
        Returns:
        the next page to show as named in a <from-outcome> element in faces_config.xml

      • downloadClick

        public void downloadClick()
        The procedure downloadClick() is called if the user clicks the button to download the course of appearance in XML format.

      • getBatchOptions

        public List<javax.faces.model.SelectItem> getBatchOptions()
        The function getBatchOptions() returns the granularity levels available to summarize the processes to create in batches along with their verbal description to be shown to the user. The available values depend on the granularity value of the global variable “granularity”: Only granularity values broader than the chosen option are available. If the year level is chosen, or if “granularity” isn’t set, only the null value, indicating the function is in “off” state, is returned along with a verbal description of the cause.
        Returns:
        the granularity level chosen by the user

      • getGranularity

        public String getGranularity()
        The function getGranularity() returns the granularity level chosen by the user in lower case as read-only property “granularity”. If there are no processes—indicating that the user didn’t choose anything yet or didn’t choose anything again after clicking back in the bread crumbs and altering the course of appearance in a way that the processes need to be recalculated—it literally returns “null” as String. If there are processes loaded from a foreign source, it returns “foreign”.
        Returns:
        the granularity level chosen by the user

      • getIssueCount

        public long getIssueCount()
        The function getIssueCount() returns the number of issues that physically appeared as to the underlying course of appearance data model as read-only property “issueCount”.
        Returns:
        the number of issues physically appeared

      • getLockMessage

        public String getLockMessage()
        The function getLockMessage() returns an empty string if either no limit for the minimal number of pages per process has been configured, or the limit has been reached, which will allow normal processing. Otherwise, an error message string is returned, explaining the user how to fix the problem. Quotes are replaced for not to break the Javascript in action here.
        Returns:
        an error message, or the empty string if everything is okay.

      • getNumberOfPages

        public Long getNumberOfPages()
        The function getNumberOfPages returns the total number of pages of the digitization project guessed and entered by the user—or null indicating that the user didn’t enter anything yet—as read-write property “numberOfPages”.
        Returns:
        the total number of pages of the digitization project

      • getNumberOfPagesPerIssue

        public Long getNumberOfPagesPerIssue()
        The function getNumberOfPages returns the number of pages per issue guessed and entered by the user—or null indicating that the user didn’t enter anything yet—as read-write property “numberOfPagesPerIssue”.
        Returns:
        the total number of pages of the digitization project

      • getNumberOfPagesOptionallyGuessed

        public Long getNumberOfPagesOptionallyGuessed()
        The function getNumberOfPages returns the total number of pages of the digitization project entered by the user or a guessed value as read-only property “numberOfPagesOptionallyGuessed”.
        Returns:
        an (optionally guessed) total number of pages

      • getNumberOfProcesses

        public int getNumberOfProcesses()
        The function getNumberOfProcesses() returns the number of processes that will be created. If the course had to condemn its processes because the user changed the course, the recalculation of the processes will be re-initiated here.
        Returns:
        the number of processes that will be created

      • getPagesPerProcessRounded

        public String getPagesPerProcessRounded()
        The function getPagesPerProcessRounded() returns the pages per process as a rounded string.

        This should be done in JSF using “convertNumber”, but it doesn’t show any effect and the number still prints with a decimal fractions part that is not desired. This JSF code should put the number rounded into the request scope, but rounding doesn’t work for some unknown reason. 

         <h:outputText binding="#{requestScope.pagesPerProcess}" rendered="false">
         value="#{GranularityForm.numberOfPagesOptionallyGuessed / GranularityForm.numberOfProcesses}"
     <f:convertNumber maxFractionDigits="0" />
 </h:outputText>
        Returns:
        the pages per process as a rounded string

      • getSelectedBatchOption

        public String getSelectedBatchOption()
        The function getSelectedBatchOption() returns the level for which batches will be created as read-write property “numberOfPagesOptionallyGuessed”.
        Returns:
        an (optionally guessed) total number of pages

      • issuesClick

        public void issuesClick()
        The procedure issuesClick() is called if the user clicks the button to select the granularity level “issues”. It sets the granularity to BreakMode.ISSUES and triggers the recalculation of the breaks in the course of appearance data model.

      • monthsClick

        public void monthsClick()
        The procedure monthsClick() is called if the user clicks the button to select the granularity level “months”. It sets the granularity to BreakMode.MONTHS and triggers the recalculation of the breaks in the course of appearance data model.

      • quartersClick

        public void quartersClick()
        The procedure monthsClick() is called if the user clicks the button to select the granularity level “quarters”. It sets the granularity to BreakMode.MONTHS and triggers the recalculation of the breaks in the course of appearance data model.

      • setCourse

        public void setCourse(Course course)
        The method setCourse() is called by JSF to inject the course data model into the form. This behaviour is configured in faces-config.xml
        Parameters:
        course - Course of appearance data model to be used

      • setNumberOfPagesPerIssue

        public void setNumberOfPagesPerIssue(Long value)
        The procedure setNumberOfPagesPerIssue() is called by Faces on postbacks to save the received value of the read-write property “numberOfPagesPerIssue”.
        Parameters:
        value - new value to be stored

      • setSelectedBatchOption

        public void setSelectedBatchOption(String option)
        The procedure setSelectedBatchOption() is called by Faces on postbacks to save the received value of the read-write property “selectedBatchOption”.
        Parameters:
        option - Granularity level for which batches will be created

      • weeksClick

        public void weeksClick()
        The procedure weeksClick() is called if the user clicks the button to select the granularity level “weeks”. It sets the granularity to BreakMode.WEEKS and triggers the recalculation of the breaks in the course of appearance data model.

      • yearsClick

        public void yearsClick()
        The procedure yearsClick() is called if the user clicks the button to select the granularity level “years”. It sets the granularity to BreakMode.YEARS and triggers the recalculation of the breaks in the course of appearance data model.
